article.title: ALMA observations of cold molecular gas in AGN hosts at z 1.5 - Evidence of AGN feedback?

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 shows the location of the AGN sample in relation to the Main Sequence (MS) of star-forming galaxies. What does the solid black line represent?
choices: The MS line as defined by Pannella et al. (2009).
The MS line as defined by Schreiber et al. (2015) with a scatter of 0.3 dex.
The division between starburst galaxies and MS galaxies.
The redshift evolution of AGN activity.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 displays the ALMA spectra of CO-detected AGNs. What does the double-peaked profile observed in C1591 (middle panel) suggest about this galaxy?
choices: A rotating disk of molecular gas.
A high rate of star formation.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 presents HST and ALMA images of the AGN sample. What can be concluded from the comparison between the spatial extent of CO emission and the UV/optical counterpart in these images?
choices: CO emission is significantly more extended than the UV/optical counterpart in all cases.
CO emission is significantly less extended than the UV/optical counterpart in all cases.
CO emission generally shows a similar spatial extent compared to the UV/optical counterpart.
No conclusion can be drawn about the relationship between CO and UV/optical emission from these images.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (1) is used to calculate the dynamical mass of a galaxy. What assumption is made about the dark matter component within the half-light radius (r1/2) when applying this equation?
choices: Dark matter is negligible within the half-light radius.
Dark matter contributes 25% of the total dynamical mass within the half-light radius.
Dark matter contributes 50% of the total dynamical mass within the half-light radius.
Dark matter is uniformly distributed throughout the galaxy.
